derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from French réunion or Anglo-Latin reunio(n-), from Latin reunire 'unite'

entry.tran: （家庭、学校及其他团体成员的）团聚，重聚，聚会
entry.def: A reunion is a party attended by members of the same family, school, or other group who have not seen each other for a long time.

example.ex: The Association holds an annual reunion...
example.tran: 这个协会每年聚会一次。

example.ex: The whole family was there for this big family reunion.
example.tran: 全家人都来参加了这次盛大的家庭聚会。

entry.def: A reunion is a meeting between people who have been separated for some time.

example.ex: The children weren't allowed to see her for nearly a week. It was a very emotional reunion.
example.tran: 孩子们将近一周都没能见到她。这是一次令人激动的团聚。

means.word_mean: 1. a party of former associates who have come together again
2. the act of coming together again;

sentences.sentence: "monetary unification precipitated the reunification of the German state in October 1990"

sentences.en: We have a family reunion every New Year's Day.

jushi.english: We had a happy reunion after many years.
jushi.chinese: 我们在分别多年之后又愉快地团聚在一起。

jushi.english: They're waiting for the reunion of the different teams.
jushi.chinese: 他们等待不同组之间的再联合。
